journals.notes:
This is a known issue. Previous version is incompatible with vanilla demos that's why it crashes. 

We won't change that again.

Yeah I know that it's logical that older version's demos don't work but still the main issue here is that the brightness of the desktop changes whenever ET:L crashes. It's not just about that specific crash I had but I noticed it before too.

-*S

That is not something we can control, the gamma ramp is set to the display driver and would get reset back to normal on normal exit, but if the game crashes then the gamma ramp will not get reset back to normal alas the screen looks bright on windows.

This is also the way it works on the vanilla ET (or any other game that messes arround with the screens gamma settings), now the fix for this is to actually adjust the gamma via glsl shader which is how we do it with renderer 2. So what i am saying that this issue has already been solved on r2 and it cannot be helped on r1.

Well then everything is just fine if that's so.

-*S

subject: When etl.exe crashes, desktop's brightness will change
description:
Ok I got this tiny problem. The crash that occured each time I watched an old demo which was from previous version. Everything is fine until the demo reaches the end. ET:L crashes and my desktop's brightness goes brighter. This happens whenever ET:L crashes.

I'm not certain but this might have happened with some specific games only. Not all the games have this problem when they crash. It's a rare issue but it's rather annoying because it's way too bright and it goes away only by restarting the computer.

-*S
